channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pat Gelsinger wants to save Moore’s Law, with a little help from the Feds
item.description: The company is aiming to produce its first silicon wafers by 2028 and have its first commercial system online by 2029.

item.title: Coinbase starts onboarding users again in India, plans for fiat on-ramp next year
item.description: Coinbase is exploring expansion into India with a staggered relaunch and hiring for different roles.

item.title: This AI Model Can Intuit How the Physical World Works
item.description: The V-JEPA system uses ordinary videos to understand the physics of the real world.

item.title: OpenAI says it’s turned off app suggestions that look like ads

item.title: Pat Gelsinger wants to save Moore’s Law, with a little help from the Feds
item.description: The company is aiming to produce its first silicon wafers by 2028 and have its first commercial system online by 2029.

item.title: Meta reportedly delays mixed reality glasses until 2027
item.description: aMeta lready sells VR headsets and Ray-Ban smart glasses, but these new glasses sound a bit different. Their format factor would reportedly be similar...

item.title: Is it time to ‘refound’ your startup?
item.description: Sometimes, founding a startup just once isn’t enough.
